page.title: 14RELIGION IN PLUMPTON
page.content: The church is situated in the middle of Plumpton and was built in 1891,consecrated in 1893.In 1983 it was the church's 90th anniversary.An annexe was also built in 1983.A war memorial was placed beside the church after the First World War. The present rector is Revd.D.Laughton who's been rector since 1977.There is a weekly prayer group,choir practice and a Sunday School three schoolboys sing in the choir.East Chiltington church is a Norman church,known for its beautiful setting. It has a parish of 250 people.The registers date from 1661.The new gates are in memory of Major Powell Edwards who owned Novington Manor.The Revd D.Laughton is also rector here.The Chapel was built in 1880.There are regular Sunday services.William Wells,a pupil's grand father, built this chapel.
